content:
That sounds like a perfect plan! Visiting the Art Institute on a weekday morning is a great idea, as it's usually less crowded than weekends. And, of course, grabbing lunch at one of the casual spots near the Riverwalk is a great way to refuel and enjoy the views.

I'm glad you mentioned the Kimpton Hotel Monaco again! It's a fantastic hotel, and the free wine hour is definitely a perk. The quirky decor in the lobby is also a great touch - Kimpton hotels are known for their unique and stylish designs.

It's great that you're taking a more relaxed approach this time around. Sometimes, it's nice to slow down and enjoy the city at a leisurely pace. The Riverwalk is a beautiful place to take a stroll, and you can stop and admire the views, take some photos, or simply people-watch.

If you're feeling adventurous, you could also consider taking a boat tour or a stroll along the Lakefront Trail, which runs along the shores of Lake Michigan. The views of the city skyline from the lake are simply stunning.

Whatever you choose to do, I hope you have a wonderful time in Chicago and enjoy your relaxed approach to exploring the city!
